result.execSummary:
The defendant John E Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Not Causing or Not Likely/Cause Bodily Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)1.
  • Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Not Causing or Not Likely/Cause Bodily Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)1.
  • Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Not Causing or Not Likely/Cause Bodily Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)1.
  • Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Not Causing or Not Likely/Cause Bodily Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)1.
  • Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Not Causing or Not Likely/Cause Bodily Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)1.
  • Recklessly Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Not Causing or Not Likely to Cause Bodily Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)2.
  • Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Not Causing or Not Likely/Cause Bodily Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John E Morris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
To each of the 7 counts of the Amended Information:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by Janis M.
Count 1:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, 0 days credit.
Count 2:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1.
Count 3:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2.
Count 4:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 3.
Count 5:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with counts 1-4.
Count 6:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with counts 1-5.
Count 7:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with counts 1-6.
The Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges, DNA surcharges during the period of probation imposed in 14CF589.  Failure to pay costs and surcharges will result in entry of civil judgment.
Defendant is remanded.
Filed in 14CF589:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H. Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court is advised by counsels that there have been additional negotiations based upon the information that is contained in the presentence investigation provided by defense authored by Jacqueline Schmidt.  The victim indicated that she DID have knowledge of photos being taken of her.
Based upon this information, the state is moving to allow the defendant to withdraw his pleas entered on 6-30-2014 and for the court to vacate the convictions entered on that date.  Defense will stipulate.
The defendant will waive any challenge to statute of limitations.
The Court will grant motion and orders that the pleas and convictions entered on 6-30-2014 are VACATED.
AMENDED INFORMATION is filed by the state:
Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 7: Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse-not causing or not likely to cause bodily harm, class B misdemeanors 940.285(2)(a)1
Count 6: Recklessly Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse-not causing or not likely to cause bodily harm, a class B
misdemeanor 940.285(2)(a)2
Independent presentence report received and filed.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H. Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for sentencing hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court grants the joint request for adjournment.  Case remains calendared in Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for motion hearing, however defense would like to proceed with a plea hearing. 

Pursuant to negotiations Counts 6-11 are dismissed but read in for the purposes of sentencing.  As to Counts 1-5:

  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.     Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Jury trial scheduled for 07/14/2014 is vacated.  Defense will be ordering a private PSI.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State has not had a chance to review the defense suppression motion as she has been in trial for the last 10 days.
The Court will hear arguments as to the State's Motion for Consolidation of cases.  The Court will vacate the 6-24-2014 final pretrial date and set these matters for motion hearing on 6-30-2014.  Jury trial date of 7-14-2014 to stand.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Photographic Evidence Obtained as a result of an Illegal Search and Illegally obtained Search Warrant, filed.
Defense objection to consolidation of cases received and filed.

Attorney Derek H Goodman in court, defendant John E Morris not in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has filed a motion to consolidate with 14CF589 to which the defense has filed an objection today.
Defendant is to be present when the motion is argued and the Court renders its decision.
Defense counsel advises that he will be filing additional dispositive motions in the next 10 days.  Court directs that any additional motions are to be filed by 5-28-2014.
Speedy trial demand entered.  Case set for final pretrial on 6-24-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-14-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. Motion hearing is set for 6-3-2014 at 8:15am.
to Consolidate Cases for trial received and filed.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case has been previously calendared for Scheduling Conference on May 14, 2014 at 8:15 a.m. in Branch 38.
Appointing Attorney at County Expense as to 14CF589 and 14Cf1793

Case is adjourned to 5-7-2014 at 1:30pm for preliminary hearing.
(Clerk contacted clerk in prelim court to obtain date.)
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JRM, her residence or her family.

Defendant John E Morris in court with attorney Derek H Goodman.  Defendant John E Morris in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  The Court will appoint Atty Derek Goodman to represent defendant due to pending case 14CF589.
Atty Goodman acknowledges receipt of discovery.
